etymology.description: 啤 (phonetic borrowing of “beer/Bier”) + 酒 (alcohol) = beer.
etymology.interpretation: 啤 is a phonetic borrowing signaling the foreign origin and sound, while 酒 supplies the category ‘alcoholic drink’. Coined in the late 19th–20th century as Western beer entered East Asia.

parts.english: phonetic loan; used in transliterations; beer- (in compounds)

examples.chinese: 我们去酒吧喝啤酒(我們去酒吧喝啤酒)。
examples.english: We’re going to a bar to drink beer.

examples.chinese: 夏天喝冰啤酒很解渴(夏天喝冰啤酒很解渴)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān hē bīng píjiǔ hěn jiěkě.
examples.english: Drinking cold beer in summer is very refreshing.

examples.chinese: 这款啤酒带有麦香和微苦的味道(這款啤酒帶有麥香和微苦的味道)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuǎn píjiǔ dàiyǒu màixiāng hé wēikǔ de wèidào.
examples.english: This beer has a malty aroma with a slight bitterness.
